Name: Steel
Drawback1: Prone to rust without protective coatings
Drawback2: Heavy, requiring strong support structures
Drawback3: High thermal conductivity, can get very hot or cold.

Name: Aluminum
Drawback1: Lower strength than steel, susceptible to denting
Drawback2: Difficult to weld, requiring specialized techniques
Drawback3: Corrodes in salt water, leading to pitting.

Name: Copper
Drawback1: High cost, making it expensive for large projects
Drawback2: Oxidizes over time, forming a greenish patina
Drawback3: Relatively soft, easily deformed or scratched.

Name: Oak Wood
Drawback1: Susceptible to moisture damage, leading to warping
Drawback2: Can rot if not properly sealed and maintained
Drawback3: Flammable, posing fire risk in certain applications.

Name: Pine Wood
Drawback1: Less durable than hardwoods, prone to dents
Drawback2: Highly susceptible to rot and insect infestation
Drawback3: Flammable, easily ignites in fires.

Name: Concrete
Drawback1: Low tensile strength, prone to cracking under tension
Drawback2: Long curing time before full strength is achieved
Drawback3: Heavy, increasing foundation and structural requirements.

Name: Glass
Drawback1: Extremely brittle, shatters easily on impact
Drawback2: Poor insulator, allowing heat to escape easily
Drawback3: Difficult to repair once scratched or cracked.

Name: Rubber
Drawback1: Degrades in UV light, becoming brittle over time
Drawback2: Susceptible to oils and chemicals, causing swelling
Drawback3: Poor resistance to sharp objects, easily punctured.

Name: Nylon
Drawback1: Absorbs moisture, leading to dimensional changes
Drawback2: Can degrade under prolonged UV exposure
Drawback3: Low melting point, unsuitable for high-temp uses.

Name: Polyethylene
Drawback1: Low strength compared to other plastics
Drawback2: Easily scratched and marred, affecting appearance
Drawback3: Degrades when exposed to strong UV radiation.

Name: Carbon Fiber
Drawback1: Very expensive to produce and process
Drawback2: Brittle, can crack under sudden, sharp impact
Drawback3: Difficult to repair once damaged, requiring specialized techniques.

Name: Titanium
Drawback1: Very high cost due to complex extraction
Drawback2: Difficult to machine, requiring specialized tooling
Drawback3: Can become brittle at extremely high temperatures.

Name: Brass
Drawback1: Prone to tarnishing, requiring regular polishing
Drawback2: Lower strength than steel, not for high-load uses
Drawback3: Can be susceptible to dezincification in certain environments.

Name: Limestone
Drawback1: Porous, susceptible to water absorption and freeze-thaw
Drawback2: Soft, easily scratched and eroded by acids
Drawback3: Heavy, adding significant weight to structures.

Name: Brick
Drawback1: Porous, susceptible to moisture absorption
Drawback2: Requires mortar, adding labor and cost
Drawback3: Heavy, increasing structural load on foundations.

Name: Ceramic
Drawback1: Extremely brittle, prone to shattering on impact
Drawback2: Difficult to machine, requiring specialized tools
Drawback3: Poor tensile strength, cracks under pulling forces.

Name: Lead
Drawback1: Toxic, posing health risks if ingested or inhaled
Drawback2: Very heavy, limiting its application in some areas
Drawback3: Low melting point, unsuitable for high-temp uses.

Name: Silver
Drawback1: High cost, making it impractical for many uses
Drawback2: Tarnishes over time, requiring cleaning and polishing
Drawback3: Relatively soft, easily scratched and dented.

Name: Gold
Drawback1: Extremely high cost, making it impractical for most uses
Drawback2: Very soft, easily scratched and deformed
Drawback3: Low strength, not suitable for structural applications.

Name: Platinum
Drawback1: Extremely high cost, limiting widespread use
Drawback2: Very dense, adding significant weight
Drawback3: Difficult to machine due to its hardness and density.

Name: Magnesium
Drawback1: Highly reactive, especially with water and acids
Drawback2: Flammable in powder or thin strip form
Drawback3: Low fatigue strength, prone to cracking under cyclic loading.

Name: Zinc
Drawback1: Can suffer from 'zinc pest' at low temperatures
Drawback2: Lower melting point than other metals
Drawback3: Relatively soft, susceptible to abrasion.

Name: Polyester
Drawback1: Not breathable, can feel uncomfortable in clothing
Drawback2: Susceptible to static electricity buildup
Drawback3: Poor resistance to strong alkalis and acids.

Name: Acrylic
Drawback1: Easily scratched, affecting its clarity over time
Drawback2: Less impact resistant than polycarbonate
Drawback3: Can yellow over long-term UV exposure.

Name: PVC
Drawback1: Releases toxic fumes when burned
Drawback2: Not UV stable without additives, becomes brittle
Drawback3: Can become rigid and brittle in cold temperatures.

Name: Glass Fiber
Drawback1: Brittle, prone to shattering under sharp impact
Drawback2: Difficult to recycle, contributing to landfill waste
Drawback3: Can cause skin irritation from fibers.

Name: Polycarbonate
Drawback1: Easily scratched, requiring hard coatings
Drawback2: Can yellow over prolonged UV exposure
Drawback3: Susceptible to stress cracking from certain chemicals.

Name: HDPE
Drawback1: Lower strength than engineering plastics
Drawback2: Easily scratched, affecting its appearance
Drawback3: Flammable, melting and dripping when ignited.

Name: LDPE
Drawback1: Low strength, easily stretched and torn
Drawback2: Not suitable for high temperature applications
Drawback3: Permeable to gases, limiting barrier applications.

Name: Silicone
Drawback1: High cost compared to other rubbers
Drawback2: Low tear strength, can be easily ripped
Drawback3: Can absorb oils, leading to swelling and degradation.

Name: Tungsten
Drawback1: Extremely brittle, shatters under impact
Drawback2: Very difficult to machine due to extreme hardness
Drawback3: Highest melting point, requiring extreme temperatures for processing.

Name: Chromium
Drawback1: Brittle, can crack under stress
Drawback2: Toxic in certain forms, posing health risks
Drawback3: Difficult to plate evenly on surfaces.

Name: Urethane
Drawback1: Can yellow over time with UV exposure
Drawback2: Susceptible to hydrolysis in humid environments
Drawback3: Poor chemical resistance to strong solvents.

Name: Polypropylene
Drawback1: Can be brittle at low temperatures
Drawback2: Degrades with prolonged UV exposure
Drawback3: Oxidizes at high temperatures.

Name: Expanded Polystyrene (EPS)
Drawback1: Highly flammable, producing toxic smoke
Drawback2: Low strength, easily damaged by impact
Drawback3: Non-biodegradable, a significant environmental pollutant.

Name: Neoprene
Drawback1: More expensive than natural rubber
Drawback2: Poor resistance to strong oxidizing acids
Drawback3: Can stiffen in extremely cold temperatures.

Name: Ceramic Tiles
Drawback1: Brittle, prone to cracking if dropped
Drawback2: Requires grout, which can stain and crack
Drawback3: Heavy, adding significant load to floors.

Name: Gypsum
Drawback1: Very soft, easily scratched and dented
Drawback2: Highly susceptible to water damage and mold
Drawback3: Low strength, not suitable for structural applications.

Name: Asphalt
Drawback1: Degrades under UV light, becoming brittle
Drawback2: Softens in hot weather, creating ruts
Drawback3: Requires regular maintenance and resurfacing.

Name: Granite
Drawback1: Very heavy, requiring strong structural support
Drawback2: Porous, needs sealing to prevent staining
Drawback3: Can crack under extreme thermal shock.

Name: Quartz
Drawback1: Brittle, can chip or shatter on impact
Drawback2: Heavy, contributing to structural load
Drawback3: Does not tolerate sudden temperature changes well.

Name: Teflon (PTFE)
Drawback1: Expensive, limiting its broad application
Drawback2: Low strength, not suitable for structural uses
Drawback3: Can creep under sustained pressure at high temperatures.

Name: Polyurethane Foam
Drawback1: Flammable without fire retardants
Drawback2: Degrades in UV light, becoming brittle
Drawback3: Can absorb water if not properly sealed.

Name: Kevlar
Drawback1: Expensive to produce and process
Drawback2: Degrades under UV exposure, losing strength
Drawback3: Difficult to cut and machine, requiring specialized tools.

Name: Fiberglass
Drawback1: Can be brittle, prone to cracking on impact
Drawback2: Fibers can cause skin irritation
Drawback3: Difficult to recycle, contributing to landfill waste.

Name: Silica Gel
Drawback1: Can absorb moisture, limiting its use
Drawback2: Fragile, easily broken into dust
Drawback3: Not suitable for structural applications.

Name: Wood Plastic Composite (WPC)
Drawback1: Can warp or swell if moisture gets trapped
Drawback2: Less strong and stiff than solid wood
Drawback3: Susceptible to fading from UV exposure.

Name: Aerogel
Drawback1: Extremely brittle, very easily shattered
Drawback2: Very expensive to produce, making it prohibitive
Drawback3: Hydrophobic versions absorb water, losing properties.

Name: Graphite
Drawback1: Brittle, prone to chipping and breaking
Drawback2: Soft, easily smudged and worn away
Drawback3: Can be abrasive in certain applications.

Name: Cork
Drawback1: Susceptible to moisture damage and mold growth
Drawback2: Can be easily punctured or torn
Drawback3: Limited structural strength for load-bearing.

Name: Cellulose
Drawback1: Highly flammable without fire retardants
Drawback2: Susceptible to rot and insect attack
Drawback3: Low strength compared to synthetic fibers.

Name: Nickel
Drawback1: Can cause allergic reactions in some individuals
Drawback2: Relatively expensive, limiting broad use
Drawback3: Magnetic, can interfere with electronic devices.

Name: Tin
Drawback1: Low melting point, unsuitable for high-temp uses
Drawback2: Weak, easily deformed under stress
Drawback3: Prone to "tin pest" at very low temperatures.

Name: Tungsten Carbide
Drawback1: Very brittle, prone to shattering on impact
Drawback2: Extremely difficult to machine, requiring specialized tools
Drawback3: High cost due to complex manufacturing process.

Name: Alumina (Aluminum Oxide)
Drawback1: Extremely brittle, shatters easily on impact
Drawback2: Difficult to process, requiring high temperatures
Drawback3: Poor thermal shock resistance, cracks with rapid change.

Name: Zirconia (Zirconium Oxide)
Drawback1: High cost due to complex manufacturing process
Drawback2: Can be brittle, prone to chipping or cracking
Drawback3: Difficult to machine, requiring specialized equipment.

Name: Silicon Carbide
Drawback1: Very brittle, prone to shattering on impact
Drawback2: Difficult to synthesize and process
Drawback3: High cost for large-scale production.

Name: Sapphire
Drawback1: Extremely high cost, limiting practical applications
Drawback2: Very brittle, shatters easily under impact
Drawback3: Difficult to shape, requiring specialized cutting.

Name: Plexiglass (PMMA)
Drawback1: Easily scratched, affecting optical clarity
Drawback2: Less impact resistant than polycarbonate
Drawback3: Can crack under high stress or certain chemicals.

Name: Polystyrene (PS)
Drawback1: Very brittle, shatters easily on impact
Drawback2: Flammable, releasing harmful smoke when burned
Drawback3: Degrades quickly under UV light, becoming brittle.

Name: ABS Plastic
Drawback1: Not UV stable, can degrade outdoors
Drawback2: Poor resistance to strong solvents
Drawback3: Can produce toxic fumes when burned.

Name: Polyvinylidene Fluoride (PVDF)
Drawback1: High cost compared to other plastics
Drawback2: Difficult to process due to high melting point
Drawback3: Can be rigid and brittle at low temperatures.

Name: Polyether Ether Ketone (PEEK)
Drawback1: Extremely high cost, limiting wide adoption
Drawback2: Difficult to process, requiring specialized equipment
Drawback3: Can absorb moisture, affecting dimensional stability.

Name: Tungsten Heavy Alloy
Drawback1: Very high cost due to complex manufacturing
Drawback2: Brittle, can shatter under severe impact
Drawback3: Difficult to machine, requiring specialized tooling.

Name: Inconel
Drawback1: Extremely high cost, limiting widespread use
Drawback2: Difficult to machine, requiring specialized tooling
Drawback3: Can work-harden rapidly, complicating fabrication.

Name: Hastelloy
Drawback1: Very high cost, making it expensive for projects
Drawback2: Difficult to machine, requiring specialized equipment
Drawback3: Can be susceptible to stress corrosion cracking in specific environments.

Name: Cobalt
Drawback1: High cost, limiting its use in some fields
Drawback2: Can be brittle, prone to cracking under stress
Drawback3: Associated with some health concerns (e.g., allergies).

Name: Bismuth
Drawback1: Extremely brittle, shatters easily
Drawback2: Low melting point, unsuitable for high-temp uses
Drawback3: Can deform under sustained pressure (creep).

Name: Cadmium
Drawback1: Extremely toxic, posing severe health risks
Drawback2: Environmental pollutant, difficult to dispose of safely
Drawback3: Relatively soft, easily scratched and deformed.

Name: Iridium
Drawback1: Extremely high cost, limiting practical uses
Drawback2: Very dense, adding significant weight
Drawback3: Difficult to machine due to hardness.

Name: Osmium
Drawback1: Extremely high cost, limiting practical applications
Drawback2: Very dense, adding significant weight to structures
Drawback3: Highly brittle, shatters easily on impact.

Name: Rhodium
Drawback1: Extremely high cost, limiting broad applications
Drawback2: Relatively brittle, prone to cracking
Drawback3: Difficult to work with due to high melting point.

Name: Palladium
Drawback1: High cost, though less than platinum or gold
Drawback2: Relatively soft, can be scratched or dented
Drawback3: Can absorb hydrogen, potentially affecting properties.

Name: Molybdenum
Drawback1: High melting point, difficult to process
Drawback2: Brittle at room temperature, prone to cracking
Drawback3: Oxidizes at high temperatures, requiring protective coatings.

Name: Niobium
Drawback1: High cost, limiting widespread use
Drawback2: Reacts with oxygen at high temperatures, requiring inert atmosphere
Drawback3: Difficult to machine due to its ductility.

Name: Tantalum
Drawback1: Very high cost, limiting practical applications
Drawback2: Very dense, adding significant weight
Drawback3: Difficult to machine due to its ductility and hardness.

Name: Germanium
Drawback1: Extremely brittle, shatters easily
Drawback2: High cost for specialized applications
Drawback3: Sensitive to high temperatures, affecting electrical properties.

Name: Indium
Drawback1: Very soft, easily scratched and deformed
Drawback2: Low melting point, unsuitable for high-temp uses
Drawback3: Can suffer from "tin pest" like phenomena.

Name: Gallium
Drawback1: Extremely low melting point, melts in hand
Drawback2: Can corrode other metals upon contact
Drawback3: Brittle at low temperatures.

Name: Selenium
Drawback1: Toxic in large quantities, posing health risks
Drawback2: Brittle, easily broken into powder
Drawback3: Degrades with exposure to sunlight.

Name: Tellurium
Drawback1: Toxic, posing health risks with exposure
Drawback2: Brittle, easily shattered or powdered
Drawback3: Forms volatile compounds, producing unpleasant odors.

Name: Beryllium
Drawback1: Highly toxic, requiring strict handling protocols
Drawback2: Very expensive to extract and process
Drawback3: Extremely brittle, shatters under impact.

Name: Vanadium
Drawback1: High cost, limiting widespread use
Drawback2: Difficult to machine due to its hardness
Drawback3: Can absorb gases at high temperatures, affecting properties.

Name: Uranium
Drawback1: Highly radioactive, requiring extreme safety precautions
Drawback2: Very heavy, limiting applications
Drawback3: Can corrode and oxidize in air.

Name: Thorium
Drawback1: Radioactive, requiring safety protocols
Drawback2: Can oxidize in air, forming a black layer
Drawback3: Relatively soft compared to other dense metals.

Name: Plutonium
Drawback1: Extremely dangerous radioactive material
Drawback2: High toxicity, requiring ultimate safety
Drawback3: Highly unstable, can change volume with temperature.

Name: Silicon
Drawback1: Extremely brittle, shatters easily
Drawback2: Poor ductility, cannot be easily shaped
Drawback3: Reacts with strong bases and hydrofluoric acid.

Name: Silicon Nitride
Drawback1: Very brittle, prone to shattering on impact
Drawback2: Difficult to machine, requiring specialized tooling
Drawback3: High manufacturing cost.

Name: Boron Nitride
Drawback1: Very high cost for production
Drawback2: Extremely brittle, shatters easily
Drawback3: Difficult to synthesize in large quantities.

Name: Diamond
Drawback1: Extremely high cost, limiting practical uses
Drawback2: Very brittle, shatters under sharp impact
Drawback3: Can be damaged by extreme heat or oxygen.

Name: Graphene
Drawback1: Extremely high cost, difficult to scale production
Drawback2: Difficult to manipulate and integrate into larger structures
Drawback3: Can be highly reactive depending on environment.

Name: Boron
Drawback1: Very brittle, shatters easily
Drawback2: High cost for extraction and purification
Drawback3: Difficult to synthesize in pure form.

Name: Sodium
Drawback1: Highly reactive with water, producing hydrogen gas
Drawback2: Flammable, ignites easily in air
Drawback3: Corrosive to skin, causing chemical burns.

Name: Potassium
Drawback1: Extremely reactive with water, highly flammable
Drawback2: Ignites spontaneously in air, very dangerous
Drawback3: Corrosive to skin, causing severe burns.

Name: Calcium
Drawback1: Reacts with water, producing hydrogen gas
Drawback2: Corrodes readily in air, forming a white layer
Drawback3: Relatively soft, easily deformed.

Name: Magnesium Alloy
Drawback1: Prone to corrosion in saline environments
Drawback2: Flammable in powder or thin strip form
Drawback3: More expensive than aluminum alloys.

Name: Titanium Alloy
Drawback1: Very high cost due to complex alloying
Drawback2: Difficult to machine, requiring specialized tooling
Drawback3: Can exhibit creep at high temperatures.

Name: Tungsten Alloy
Drawback1: Very high cost due to complex manufacturing
Drawback2: Brittle, can shatter under severe impact
Drawback3: Difficult to machine, requiring specialized tooling.

Name: Zirconium
Drawback1: High cost, limiting widespread use
Drawback2: Pyrophoric in powder form, ignites easily
Drawback3: Can react with hydrogen at high temperatures.

Name: Hafnium
Drawback1: High cost, limiting widespread use
Drawback2: Difficult to separate from zirconium
Drawback3: Heavy, adding significant weight.

Name: Rhenium
Drawback1: Extremely high cost, limiting practical applications
Drawback2: Very dense, adding significant weight
Drawback3: Brittle, prone to cracking under stress.

Name: Osmium Alloy
Drawback1: Extremely high cost, limiting practical applications
Drawback2: Very dense, adding significant weight
Drawback3: Highly brittle, shatters easily on impact.

Name: Maple Wood
Drawback1: Can be difficult to stain evenly
Drawback2: Susceptible to moisture changes
Drawback3: Can crack under extreme impact.

Name: Cherry Wood
Drawback1: Can darken significantly with UV exposure
Drawback2: Relatively soft for a hardwood
Drawback3: More expensive than common woods.

Name: Walnut Wood
Drawback1: High cost for large projects
Drawback2: Can be heavy, requiring strong support
Drawback3: Susceptible to insect damage if untreated.

Name: Mahogany Wood
FlexibilityDesc: Moderately flexible, easy to work with
Drawback1: Expensive and can be unsustainable
Drawback2: Some species are less durable
Drawback3: Can fade over time with UV exposure.

Name: Teak Wood
Drawback1: Very high cost, limited availability
Drawback2: Can be heavy and difficult to work
Drawback3: Can cause allergic reactions in some individuals.

Name: Ash Wood
Drawback1: Susceptible to emerald ash borer infestation
Drawback2: Can be prone to splitting if not dried properly
Drawback3: Moderate decay resistance.

Name: Birch Wood
Drawback1: Susceptible to decay if exposed to moisture
Drawback2: Can be difficult to stain evenly
Drawback3: Prone to warping if not dried properly.

Name: Hickory Wood
Drawback1: Very difficult to work with
Drawback2: Can be heavy, not ideal for all uses
Drawback3: Prone to checking and splitting during drying.

Name: Cedar Wood
Drawback1: Relatively soft, dents easily
Drawback2: Low strength compared to hardwoods
Drawback3: Can splinter easily.

Name: Redwood Wood
Drawback1: Can be expensive, especially clear grades
Drawback2: Soft and prone to dents
Drawback3: Less dense than some hardwoods.

Name: Pine Wood (Yellow)
DurabilityDesc: Strong for a softwood, widely available
Drawback1: Prone to sap bleed, staining finishes
Drawback2: Susceptible to insect and rot damage
Drawback3: Less durable than hardwoods.

Name: Poplar Wood
Drawback1: Very soft, easily dented and marred
Drawback2: Poor screw holding, not for heavy loads
Drawback3: Low decay resistance.

Name: Spruce Wood
Drawback1: Low strength, not for heavy structural uses
Drawback2: Highly susceptible to rot and insect infestation
Drawback3: Prone to splitting and checking.

Name: Larch Wood
Drawback1: Can be prone to splitting and cracking
Drawback2: More resinous than some woods
Drawback3: Durable but less aesthetically pleasing than others.

Name: Bamboo Wood
Drawback1: Susceptible to moisture damage if not sealed
Drawback2: Can swell and contract with humidity changes
Drawback3: Difficult to recycle composite products.

Name: Sandstone
Drawback1: Porous, susceptible to water absorption and staining
Drawback2: Soft compared to other stones, erodes easily
Drawback3: Can crumble under heavy loads.

Name: Marble
Drawback1: Porous, highly susceptible to etching from acids
Drawback2: Scratches easily, requiring careful use
Drawback3: Requires regular sealing to prevent staining.

Name: Granite (Black)
Drawback1: Very heavy, requiring strong structural support
Drawback2: Can crack under extreme thermal shock
Drawback3: Porous, needs sealing to prevent staining.

Name: Slate
Drawback1: Brittle, prone to chipping and breaking
Drawback2: Can delaminate over time
Drawback3: Heavy, requiring strong support structures.

Name: Basalt
Drawback1: Very heavy, difficult to transport and install
Drawback2: Can be brittle, prone to chipping
Drawback3: Limited color variations.

Name: Gneiss
Drawback1: Heavy, requiring strong structural support
Drawback2: Can be difficult to cut and shape
Drawback3: Prone to flaking if exposed to freeze-thaw cycles.

Name: Limestone (Travertine)
Drawback1: Highly porous, very susceptible to staining
Drawback2: Requires regular sealing and maintenance
Drawback3: Can be easily etched by acids.

Name: Onyx
Drawback1: Very brittle, prone to shattering
Drawback2: Extremely expensive, limiting practical uses
Drawback3: Porous, requires sealing and delicate cleaning.

Name: Dolomite
Drawback1: Can be porous, susceptible to staining
Drawback2: More difficult to cut than marble
Drawback3: Limited color palette compared to marble.

Name: Quartzite
Drawback1: Very heavy, requiring strong structural support
Drawback2: Can be difficult to cut, requiring specialized tools
Drawback3: More expensive than granite.

Name: Travertine
Drawback1: Highly porous, very susceptible to staining
Drawback2: Requires regular sealing and maintenance
Drawback3: Can be easily etched by acids.

Name: Soapstone
Drawback1: Extremely soft, easily scratched and dented
Drawback2: Can darken over time with oiling
Drawback3: Low abrasion resistance.

Name: Schist
Drawback1: Can delaminate, especially in thin sections
Drawback2: Heavy, requiring strong structural support
Drawback3: Difficult to cut evenly due to foliation.

Name: Gabbro
Drawback1: Very heavy, difficult to transport and install
Drawback2: Can be brittle, prone to chipping
Drawback3: Limited color variations.

Name: Serpentine
Drawback1: Soft and easily scratched
Drawback2: Can contain asbestos minerals in some forms
Drawback3: Limited use for high-traffic areas.

Name: EVA Foam
Drawback1: Easily cut and marked
Drawback2: Can tear under stress
Drawback3: Degrades with prolonged UV exposure.

Name: Worbla
FlexibilityDesc: Flexible when heated, rigid when cool
Drawback1: Expensive for large projects
Drawback2: Can be difficult to get smooth finish
Drawback3: Requires heat gun for shaping.

Name: Thibra
FlexibilityDesc: Flexible when heated, rigid when cool
Drawback1: Expensive, limited availability
Drawback2: Requires heat gun for shaping
Drawback3: Can be sticky when heated.

Name: Craft Foam
Drawback1: Very low durability, tears easily
Drawback2: Not resistant to water
Drawback3: Easily damaged.

Name: Sculpey (Polymer Clay)
HardnessDesc: Soft before baking, moderately hard after
Drawback1: Brittle when thin after baking
Drawback2: Requires oven for curing
Drawback3: Can crack if not properly kneaded.

Name: Fabric (Cotton)
Drawback1: Wrinkles easily
Drawback2: Shrinks when washed
Drawback3: Prone to fading.

Name: Lycra (Spandex)
Drawback1: Can be difficult to sew
Drawback2: Susceptible to heat damage
Drawback3: Breaks down with chlorine exposure.

Name: Satin Fabric
Drawback1: Easily snags and wrinkles
Drawback2: Difficult to sew without puckering
Drawback3: Shows stains easily.

Name: Brocade Fabric
Drawback1: Expensive
Drawback2: Heavy, not suitable for all garments
Drawback3: Can unravel easily if not finished well.

Name: Vinyl Fabric
Drawback1: Not breathable, can be uncomfortable
Drawback2: Can crack in cold temperatures
Drawback3: Difficult to sew without special foot.

Name: Plywood
Drawback1: Can warp with moisture exposure
Drawback2: Edges can splinter easily
Drawback3: Heavy for large pieces.

Name: MDF (Medium-Density Fiberboard)
Drawback1: Heavy, susceptible to moisture damage

Drawback3: Can release formaldehyde fumes.

Name: Acrylic Sheet
Drawback1: Easily scratched, affecting its clarity over time
Drawback2: Less impact resistant than polycarbonate
Drawback3: Can yellow over long-term UV exposure.

Name: Polypropylene Sheet
Drawback1: Can be brittle at low temperatures
Drawback2: Degrades with prolonged UV exposure
Drawback3: Oxidizes at high temperatures.

Name: Fiberglass Cloth
Drawback1: Requires resin, messy to work with
Drawback2: Fibers can cause skin irritation
Drawback3: Difficult to recycle.

Name: Resin (Epoxy)
Drawback1: Requires careful mixing, toxic fumes
Drawback2: Can yellow over time with UV exposure
Drawback3: Expensive for large volumes.

Name: LED Strips
Drawback1: Fragile, easily broken
Drawback2: Requires power source and wiring
Drawback3: Not waterproof unless specially coated.

Name: EL Wire
Drawback1: Low light output compared to LEDs

Name: Faux Leather
Drawback1: Not breathable, can be uncomfortable

Drawback3: Less durable than real leather.

Name: Pleated Fabric
Drawback1: Can lose pleats if washed improperly
Drawback2: Difficult to iron
Drawback3: Shows dirt easily in folds.

Name: Mesh Fabric
Drawback1: Easily snags and tears

Drawback3: Difficult to sew intricate details.

Name: Rigid PVC Sheet
Drawback1: Can become brittle in cold temperatures
Drawback2: Releases toxic fumes when burned
Drawback3: Difficult to bend without heat.

Name: Polyester Resin
Drawback1: Strong odor, requires good ventilation
Drawback2: Can be brittle if not reinforced
Drawback3: Shrinks during curing, causing warping.

Name: Heat-activated Adhesive
Drawback1: Requires heat application

Drawback3: May not bond all materials.

Name: Modelling Clay (non-drying)
Drawback1: Cannot be permanently hardened
Drawback2: Can be messy
Drawback3: Not structurally strong.

Name: Foam Core Board
Drawback1: Very fragile, easily damaged by impact
Drawback2: Susceptible to moisture and humidity
Drawback3: Not suitable for outdoor use.

Name: Cardboard
Drawback1: Very low durability, tears easily
Drawback2: Damaged by moisture
Drawback3: Not waterproof.

Name: Illustration Board
Drawback1: Can warp with humidity changes
Drawback2: Edges can fray easily
Drawback3: Not water resistant.

Name: Craft Wire
Drawback1: Can lose shape if not rigid enough
Drawback2: May tarnish over time
Drawback3: Not suitable for heavy loads.

Name: Pipe Cleaners
Drawback1: Very low durability, sheds fibers
Drawback2: Not water resistant
Drawback3: Limited structural strength.

Name: Burlap Fabric
Drawback1: Sheds fibers, messy to work with
Drawback2: Rough texture can be irritating
Drawback3: Low resistance to tearing.

Name: Felt Fabric
Drawback1: Not very durable, pills easily
Drawback2: Can stretch out of shape
Drawback3: Not water resistant.

Name: Sequins
Drawback1: Easily fall off
Drawback2: Can snag other fabrics
Drawback3: Time-consuming to apply.

Name: Feathers
Drawback1: Very delicate, easily bent or broken
Drawback2: Cannot be washed easily
Drawback3: Can shed over time.

Name: Gems (Acrylic)
Drawback1: Easily scratched, affecting clarity
Drawback2: Can look cheap compared to real gems
Drawback3: Brittle, can crack.

Name: Model Magic (Air Dry Clay)
FlexibilityDesc: Very flexible when wet, rigid when dry
HardnessDesc: Very soft when wet, soft when dry
Drawback1: Dries out if not sealed
Drawback2: Can crack if dried too quickly
Drawback3: Not water resistant once dry.

Name: Plaster of Paris
Drawback1: Very brittle, prone to chipping
Drawback2: Dusty to work with
Drawback3: Not water resistant.

Name: Fiberfill (Polyester)
Drawback1: Can flatten over time
Drawback2: Flammable if not treated
Drawback3: Not breathable.

Name: Velcro (Hook and Loop)
Drawback1: Can collect lint and dirt
Drawback2: Makes a loud ripping sound
Drawback3: Can lose adhesion over time.

Name: Zippers
Drawback1: Can get stuck or break
Drawback2: Difficult to sew for beginners
Drawback3: Adds bulk to fabric.

Name: Elastic Band
Drawback1: Can lose elasticity over time
Drawback2: Can dig into skin if too tight
Drawback3: Difficult to sew smoothly.

Name: Hot Glue
Drawback1: Not very strong, can break easily
Drawback2: Melts with heat
Drawback3: Can leave visible strings.

Name: Liquid Latex
Drawback1: Can cause allergic reactions
Drawback2: Has a strong odor
Drawback3: Degrades with exposure to oils.

Name: Spirit Gum
Drawback1: Can irritate skin
Drawback2: Difficult to remove
Drawback3: Leaves sticky residue.

Name: Upholstery Foam
Drawback1: Can sag over time
Drawback2: Flammable if not treated
Drawback3: Absorbs moisture.

Name: Tempered Glass
Drawback1: Still shatters, but into small pieces
Drawback2: Cannot be cut or drilled after tempering
Drawback3: Poor insulator compared to other materials.

Name: Borosilicate Glass
Drawback1: More expensive than soda-lime glass
Drawback2: Can still shatter with extreme impact
Drawback3: Difficult to cut and shape.

Name: Laminated Glass
DurabilityDesc: Safety glass, holds together when broken
Drawback1: More expensive than single pane glass
Drawback2: Can delaminate over time
Drawback3: Edges can look thicker due to interlayers.

Name: Fiber Optic Glass
FlexibilityDesc: Flexible in thin strands, brittle in bulk
Drawback1: Very fragile in individual fibers
Drawback2: Expensive for complex installations
Drawback3: Susceptible to bending losses.

Name: Gorilla Glass
Drawback1: Can still crack or shatter from extreme drops
Drawback2: More expensive than standard display glass
Drawback3: Does not provide impact protection for underlying components.

Name: Lead Crystal Glass
Drawback1: Contains lead, health concerns if ingested
Drawback2: Very soft, scratches easily
Drawback3: Brittle, prone to chipping.

Name: Fused Quartz Glass
Drawback1: Very expensive to produce
Drawback2: Extremely difficult to shape or machine
Drawback3: Can be brittle, prone to chipping.

Name: Ceramic Glass
Drawback1: Very brittle, shatters easily on impact
Drawback2: Difficult to machine, requiring specialized tools
Drawback3: Poor tensile strength.

Name: Patterned Glass
Drawback1: Pattern makes it harder to clean
Drawback2: Still brittle, shatters easily
Drawback3: Limited transparency.

Name: Electrochromic Glass
Drawback1: Very expensive to install
Drawback2: Requires electrical wiring
Drawback3: Can be slow to change transparency.

Name: Nickel-Titanium (Nitinol)
Drawback1: Very expensive to produce
Drawback2: Difficult to machine and process
Drawback3: Can exhibit fatigue with repeated cycling.

Name: Superconductors (NbTi)
DurabilityDesc: Zero electrical resistance at low temp
FlexibilityDesc: Extremely rigid, brittle at low temp
Drawback1: Extremely low operating temperatures (cryogenic)
Drawback2: Very expensive to produce and cool
Drawback3: Brittle, difficult to form into complex shapes.

Name: Aerospace Aluminum Alloys (e.g., 7075)
Drawback1: Expensive compared to common aluminum
Drawback2: Can be susceptible to stress corrosion cracking
Drawback3: Difficult to weld, requiring specialized techniques.

Name: Medical Grade Titanium (Ti-6Al-4V)
Drawback1: Very high cost due to complex processing
Drawback2: Difficult to machine, requiring specialized tooling
Drawback3: Can exhibit creep at high temperatures.

Name: Single Crystal Silicon
Drawback1: Extremely brittle, shatters easily
Drawback2: High cost for large, defect-free crystals
Drawback3: Poor ductility, cannot be easily shaped.

Name: Gallium Nitride (GaN)
Drawback1: Very high cost due to complex growth
Drawback2: Brittle, prone to cracking
Drawback3: Difficult to process into devices.

Name: Sapphire (Synthetic)
Drawback1: Extremely high cost, limiting practical applications
Drawback2: Very brittle, shatters easily under impact
Drawback3: Difficult to shape, requiring specialized cutting.

Name: Yttrium Stabilized Zirconia (YSZ)
Drawback1: High cost due to complex manufacturing
Drawback2: Can be brittle, prone to chipping or cracking
Drawback3: Difficult to machine, requiring specialized equipment.

Name: Silicon Nitride Ceramics (Si3N4)
Drawback1: Very brittle, prone to shattering on impact
Drawback2: Difficult to machine, requiring specialized tooling
Drawback3: High manufacturing cost.

Name: Boron Nitride (Cubic - cBN)
Drawback1: Very high cost for production
Drawback2: Extremely brittle, shatters easily
Drawback3: Difficult to synthesize in large quantities.

Name: Diamond (Industrial Synthetic)
DurabilityDesc: Hardest known material, high thermal cond
Drawback1: Extremely high cost, limiting practical uses
Drawback2: Very brittle, shatters under sharp impact
Drawback3: Can be damaged by extreme heat or oxygen.

Name: Graphene (Single Layer)
Drawback1: Extremely high cost, difficult to scale production
Drawback2: Difficult to manipulate and integrate into larger structures
Drawback3: Can be highly reactive depending on environment.

Name: Carbon Nanotubes (CNTs)
Drawback1: Extremely high cost for pure forms
Drawback2: Difficult to disperse and integrate uniformly
Drawback3: Potential health concerns (lung irritation).

Name: Aerogels (Silica)
Drawback1: Extremely brittle, very easily shattered
Drawback2: Very expensive to produce, making it prohibitive
Drawback3: Hydrophobic versions absorb water, losing properties.

Name: Shape Memory Polymers
DurabilityDesc: Can return to original shape with stimulus
Drawback1: Limited number of shape-memory cycles
Drawback2: Strength and recovery force are lower than alloys
Drawback3: Degrades with prolonged UV exposure.

Name: Electroactive Polymers (EAPs)
Drawback1: Requires high voltage for activation
Drawback2: Slow response time compared to other actuators
Drawback3: Limited durability under continuous cycling.

Name: Magnetorheological (MR) Fluids
Drawback1: Requires magnetic field for activation
Drawback2: Particles can settle over time
Drawback3: Can be expensive and messy.

Name: Piezoelectric Ceramics (PZT)
Drawback1: Very brittle, prone to shattering on impact
Drawback2: Sensitive to high temperatures
Drawback3: Can degrade under strong electric fields.

Name: High-Purity Quartz
Drawback1: Brittle, can chip or shatter on impact
Drawback2: Heavy, contributing to structural load
Drawback3: Does not tolerate sudden temperature changes well.

Name: Additive Manufacturing Powders (Ti, Ni-based)
DurabilityDesc: Used in 3D printing for complex parts
HardnessDesc: Varies by material, depends on fused form
Drawback1: Very expensive
Drawback2: Requires specialized 3D printing equipment
Drawback3: Can be difficult to achieve perfect density.

Name: High-Entropy Alloys (HEA)
Drawback1: Very complex and expensive to synthesize
Drawback2: Research in early stages, limited commercial availability
Drawback3: Processing can be challenging.

Name: Metamaterials
Drawback1: Extremely high cost
Drawback2: Difficult to manufacture with precision
Drawback3: Often have narrow operating frequency ranges.

Name: Self-Healing Polymers
Drawback1: Limited healing capacity
Drawback2: Can be expensive to synthesize
Drawback3: Healing process can be slow.

Name: Quantum Dots
HardnessDesc: Too small to measure macroscopic hardness
Drawback1: Extremely high cost
Drawback2: Potential toxicity concerns
Drawback3: Require precise control of size for specific properties.

Name: High-Temperature Superconductors (HTS)
DurabilityDesc: Zero electrical resistance at higher temp
Drawback1: Still requires significant cooling (liquid nitrogen)
Drawback2: Very expensive to produce
Drawback3: Brittle, difficult to form into long wires.

Name: Amorphous Metals (Bulk Metallic Glasses)
Drawback1: Very difficult to produce large bulk samples
Drawback2: Brittle when reaching fracture point
Drawback3: High cost due to complex processing.

Name: Carbon-Carbon Composites
DurabilityDesc: Extremely high temp resistance, high strength
Drawback1: Extremely expensive to manufacture
Drawback2: Oxidizes at high temperatures without coating
Drawback3: Very brittle, prone to catastrophic failure.

Name: Boron Carbide
Drawback1: Very brittle, shatters easily on impact
Drawback2: Difficult to machine, requires specialized tools
Drawback3: High manufacturing cost.

Name: Fused Silica
Drawback1: More expensive than standard glass
Drawback2: Can be brittle, prone to chipping
Drawback3: Difficult to cut and shape.

Name: Zirconium Dioxide (ZrO2)
Drawback1: High cost due to complex manufacturing process
Drawback2: Can be brittle, prone to chipping or cracking
Drawback3: Difficult to machine, requiring specialized equipment.
